title: Semantic Web Technology for Agent Communication Protocols

author: Idoia Berges, University of the Basque Country

In general, communication M and so far I and is based on the interchange of messages which in this context are also called communication acts.
Every eye in system has incorporated set of communication acts as its own iron communication language.
Some of those communication acts are based on already existing standards such as FIFA or Cake UML, while others are specific communication acts from particular information systems.
Unfortunately, we could imitate this scenario as a set of islands, because agents that belong to different information systems can't understand each other because they use different languages.
Effort interoperability is extremely unlikely and we would like to propose a mechanism that resolves the conflicts that arise in this scenario.
More precisely, we have developed an ontology of communication acts that can serve as a bridge between those islands and the name of that ontology is common.
